intro: Epidendrum laceratum, commonly known as the Shattered Lip Orchid, is a tropical orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking, often colorful flowers that resemble lips, with a distinctive, frayed appearance on the petals. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees and absorbing moisture and nutrients from the air.
